senses.de: To reach the same level or standard as someone or something after being behind
senses.ex: I missed a week of classes and am trying to catch up.

Tips.title: Progress Focus
Tips.description: Used when emphasizing the effort to reach a current standard or level.
Tips.example: After her vacation, she had to catch up with the rest of the class.

Tips.title: After Absence
Tips.description: Often used when returning to work or school after a break.
Tips.example: He's been out sick, but he'll catch up quickly.

Tips.title: Not Instant
Tips.description: Implies a process or period of effort, not an immediate change.
Tips.example: I'm behind on my reading, but I'll catch up over the weekend.

senses.de: To meet someone and spend time together, especially after not seeing each other for a period of time
senses.ex: I'm going to catch up with my old friend from college this weekend.

Tips.title: Reuniting
Tips.description: Used to describe a meeting after some time apart to share experiences.
Tips.example: We haven't seen each other in years! Let's catch up soon.

Tips.title: Casual Get-Together
Tips.description: Suggests informal and friendly interaction, not a formal meeting.
Tips.example: Are you free this Saturday? Let's catch up over lunch.

Tips.title: Personal Updates
Tips.description: Often used when discussing personal life updates or changes.
Tips.example: We caught up on family news at the picnic.

senses.de: To gain knowledge or information about something you have missed
senses.ex: I need to catch up on the news, I've been so busy recently.

Tips.title: Information Gap
Tips.description: Refers to learning about events or changes after being away or uninformed.
Tips.example: I have to catch up on world events; I haven't watched the news in weeks.

Tips.title: Continuous Action
Tips.description: Can refer to regularly staying informed after initial catch-up.
Tips.example: Now that I'm caught up on the reports, I'll review them weekly.

senses.de: To talk to someone in order to find out what they have been doing
senses.ex: Let's catch up at lunch, I want to hear about your trip!

Tips.title: Sharing Experiences
Tips.description: Use it to express exchanging stories about recent life events.
Tips.example: I can't wait to catch up and hear about your new job!

Tips.title: Interest in Details
Tips.description: Shows a genuine interest in the specifics of someone's life.
Tips.example: Let's catch up this weekend; I want to know all the details!
